channel.title: Getting Server online
channel.description:
Hello,
Its a long time ago since i was here at last. I always tried to code a bit with an friend of mine but never got the server online.. So we always turned up to hamachi and im sick of it now.
We both cant portforward..... really cant :o But what i saw and whats maybe better is an VPS!
Can someone maybe give me some advice about this?
Greetz

item.title: Getting Server online
item.dc:creator: @loek20 loek20
item.description:
@loek20 wrote:

As your reply, it sounds pretty easy… no portforwarding etc.
SOUNDS GOOD!

Do you also get an site if you have an VPS? because why domain?

And if you could give me a little bit more advice…
If you could choose one out of 4 VPS… wich would you chose for an rsps?

VPS 1:

RAM: 512MB

Swap-RAM: 1024MB

Harddisk: 25GB

CPU Cores: 1

Datatraffic p/month: 300GB

VPS 2:

RAM: 1024MB

Swap-RAM: 1024MB

Harddisk: 60GB

CPU Cores: 2

Datatraffic p/month: 2000GB

VPS 3:

RAM: 2048MB

Swap-RAM: 1024MB

Harddisk: 80GB

CPU Cores: 3

Datatraffic p/month: 5000GB

VPS 4:

RAM: 4096MB

Swap-RAM: 1024MB

Harddisk: 100GB

CPU Cores: 4

Datatraffic p/month: 10.000GB

Greetz.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting Server online
item.dc:creator: @Tmesis Tmesis
item.description:
@Tmesis wrote:

Basically, you order a VPS (a partition of a dedicated server: example: order web hosting here) and a domain name to along with it (optional but recommended). After they have set up the VPS for you they will email you an IP and password to log into using remote access.

You then control the VPS just like any other computer via remote access and run your server (I use two Skype accounts to transfer files over from my computer the the VPS, easier than uploading and downloading).

Set up No-IP on the VPS and people will then connect to the server via that no-ip address that you will place inside the client’s server String.

Read full topic
